pages.title: Spectrum Enchanting
pages.text: Using the Enchanter to enchant items is fairly easy:$(br)Place $(item)Enchanted Books$() onto the $(l:decoration/item_bowl)Item Bowls$(/l) and the item you want to enchant on the Enchanter itself.$(br2)Unlike regular enchanting, this will not consume the books - but will require a far greater amount of experience in exchange.
Finally supply a steady stream of experience via $(l:magical_items/knowledge_gem)Knowledge Gem$(/l) and you are set.

pages.title: Copy Enchanted Books
pages.text: You can also use this mechanism to create new $(item)Enchanted Books$(). Just put the $(item)Enchanted Book(s)$() you want to copy in the $(l:decoration/item_bowl)Item Bowls$(/l) and a $(item)simple book$() onto the $(l:enchanting/enchanter)Enchanter$(/l).$(br2)Because of the mundane nature of the books this will require lots of experience, though.

pages.title: Required Experience
pages.text: You estimate a value $(bold)between 50 and 200 experience in most cases per enchantment$().$(br)Other factors affect this, too: like how rare the enchantment is, it's level and how well the target item can absorb enchantments.$(br)Interferences, such as enchantments that are not suitable for your target, further increase this cost.
